meanings.definition: To completely change or transform something
meanings.sent1: The new technology will revolutionize how we communicate.
meanings.sent2: The invention of the wheel revolutionized transportation.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a robot chef could revolutionize the kitchen!
meanings.sent4: Her innovative approach to teaching revolutionized the classroom.
meanings.sent5: The discovery of electricity revolutionized the way we live.

meanings.definition: To bring about a radical change in a system or organization
meanings.sent1: The new manager aims to revolutionize the company's outdated policies.
meanings.sent2: The protest led to a movement that revolutionized the government.
meanings.sent3: Imagine if a talking parrot could revolutionize the pet store business!
meanings.sent4: The merger between the two companies will revolutionize the industry.
meanings.sent5: The young entrepreneur's idea could revolutionize the market.
